Issues.Title: Add control rendering tests with enabled visual styles
Issues.Body:
We have a number of rendering tests, however all of them have been developed for disabled visual styles.
New tests need to be added to:
* [ ] NumericUpDownTests (https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/UnitTests/NumericUpDownTests.cs)
* [ ] ButtonRenderingTests (https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/UnitTests/System/Windows/Forms/ButtonRenderingTests.cs)


Relates to https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/4197
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add control rendering tests with enabled visual styles" (#4212)

Issues.Title: `NumericUpDownTests` tests need to split into granular test
Issues.Body:
`NumericUpDown_BasicRendering` test currently asserts multiple states of the `NumericUpDown` controls such as rendering when the control is enabled and when it is disabled.
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/57b305f1548d8338170971fe1f5184b7145c8adb/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/UnitTests/NumericUpDownTests.cs#L24-L82

The test must be split into smaller tests that assert a single case, e.g. `NumericUpDown_BasicRendering_enabled` and ``NumericUpDown_BasicRendering_disabled`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`NumericUpDownTests` tests need to split into granular test" (#4211)

Issues.Title: Correct `EnumVariantObject` definition (servicing)
Issues.Body:
(cherry picked from commit 5af42bfbe9047fc744ff08db120129e87808481d)

Fixes #4120 (`LinkLabel` accessiblity tree)
Fixes #4121 (`CheckedListBox` accessiblity tree)
Fixes #4130 (MSAA `UpDown` controls)
Fixes #4172 (MSAA `CheckedListBox`)

Regression from 0c4d3cb9198d9246e85af732c8fa81c3f3e0d88c

## Proposed changes

- Cast `currentChild` from `uint` to `int` before using in Marshal.GetNativeVariantForObject

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

- A user can see a correct accessibility tree for controls that don't support the UIA provider using Inspect tool

- Minimal

     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or

     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Missing the "Items" list level for DomainUpDown control in the inspect tool
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.NET SDK 6.0.100-alpha.1.20559.3

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More info**

1. The issue also can reproduce on .NET 5.0 RC2.
2. The issue can't reproduce on .NET SDK 3.1 and .NET 4.8.

**Problem description:**
Missing the "Items" list level for DomainUpDown control in the inspect tool with UI Automation mode.

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create a .NET Core project with a DomainUpDown control.
2. Build and run the core project.
3. Observe the DomainUpDown control in the Inspect tool on UI Automation mode.

Or

1. Open the attached project.
2. Build and run the core project.
3. Observe the domainUpDown1 control in the Inspect tool on UI Automation mode.
[WindowsFormsApp6.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5516503/WindowsFormsApp6.zip)


**Expected behavior:**
It displays the correct levels for domainUpDown1 control in the Inspect tool.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/98657047-673e8700-237c-11eb-87e1-a87e70597443.png)

**Actual Behavior:**
Missing the "linkLabel1 link" level for domainUpDown1 control in the inspect tool.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/98657393-ca301e00-237c-11eb-9d5f-bb7e24049802.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Missing the "Items" list level for DomainUpDown control in the inspect tool" (#4207)

Issues.Title: ListView groups displayed in Inspect when visual styles are disabled
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**Additional data**
Issue is not reproduced on .NET Core 3.1

**Minimal repro**
1. Create application with ListView.
2. Add Group to ListView.
3. Add two items with group and two items without group.
4. Disable visual styles (remove "Application.EnableVisualStyles();" string from Program.cs)
5. Or import attached application ([Issue-4205.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5515750/Issue-4205.zip))
6. Run application
7. Open Inspect
8. Try to get data about ListView items

**Actual behavior:**
Groups are displayed in Inspect. Second item from group is not displayed in Inspect.
![4205-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/98647044-50c90900-2345-11eb-8b94-553045c59d2f.png)

**Expected behavior:**
Groups should not be displayed in Inspect. All items should be available in Inspect.
![4205-correct](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/98647056-54f52680-2345-11eb-8b5a-268e778e7919.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListView groups displayed in Inspect when visual styles are disabled" (#4205)

Issues.Title: Form designer gets smaller after setting the Localizable of Form as True and setting a Language for it
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
.NET SDK 6.0.100-alpha.1.20559.3

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

* More info:
1. This issue only reproduced on .NET 6.0. 
2. When targeting to .NET 5.0 & .NET Core 3.1, this issue cannot repro.
3. This issue also can repro just re-open the form designer and no build operation.

**Problem description:**
When setting the Localizable of Form as True and setting a Language for it, the Form designer will be smaller after build, close and re-open form designer, it still doesn't go back to its original size.
![Repro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/98645127-79182e00-236c-11eb-96a2-432d097e7aaf.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
The Form designer should not be smaller and show its original size.

**Minimal repro:** 
[DemoApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5515623/DemoApp.zip)

1. Create a winforms core project and target to .NET 6.0
2. Set the **Localizable** of Form as True and **Language** as Korean
3. Build the project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form designer gets smaller after setting the Localizable of Form as True and setting a Language for it" (#4204)

Issues.Title: Enable visual styles in test
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**

Currently our tests are run with visual styles off, and a number of selected tests (that require visual styles) are run via `RemoteExecutor`, or run as integration tests via MAUI test project.

This configuration has the following issues:
- The majority of our users run their apps with visual styles on, so we are not testing the main scenario.
- By not running tests with visual styles, the tests are run against comctl32 v5, not v6. They have different implementations, and observed test issues are likely totally unrepresentative of situations the majority of our users may encounter.
- `RemoteExecutor` has proven to be very unstable and problematic, and a number of tests the rely on it has been disabled (https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3633)

**Expected:**

1. Enable visual styles in tests, and fix failing tests
2. Remove reliance on `RemoteExecutor`
3. Consider running the test suite with and without visual styles (skipping those tests that do not work in one configuration or the other).


/cc: @AdamYoblick for visibility
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enable visual styles in test" (#4200)

Issues.Title: AccessibilityInsight: The edit listview item must support the Text pattern when ListView's LabelEdit is true
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 6.0.100-alpha.1.20555.6

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open the attached WindowsFormsApp7.zip application in VS, then build and run it.
[WindowsFormsApp7.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5500560/WindowsFormsApp7.zip)
2. Launch AccessibilityInsight  tool to focus on ListView control

**Actual behavior:**
When ListView's LabelEdit property is true, the edit ListView items doesn't support the Text Pattern, and AccessibilityInsight detects this error.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/98354714-10733d80-205c-11eb-8872-da1f3a408db7.png)

**Expected behavior:**
When ListView's LabelEdit property is true, the edit ListView items support the Text Pattern.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AccessibilityInsight: The edit listview item must support the Text pattern when ListView's LabelEdit is true" (#4198)

Issues.Title: Narrator and Inspect become unresponsive inspecting `Combobox` control
Issues.Body:
Fixes #3452


## Proposed changes
Issue is reproduced due to incorrect implementation of the "ComboBoxAccessibleObject.IRawElementProviderHwndOverride" method. After [adding of "ComImport" attribute](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/commit/423b2bc5726b4109741f189e34e5f37f90140d01), the "ComboBoxAccessibleObject.IRawElementProviderHwndOverride" method started to be used, which lead to an issue. As fix for it, [we removed "ComImport"](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3524) and stopped to using it.

I suggest to restore "ComImport" and remove overriding "ComboBoxAccessibleObject.IRawElementProviderHwndOverride" method.

## Customer Impact
No

## Regression? 
- Yes

## Risk
- Minimal 

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->
- CTI 
- Manually

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->
- Inspect
- Narrator

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.388]
- .Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15

Issues.Title: Fix issue with hanging of accessibility tools when the "ComboBox" to be expanded contains duplicate items
Issues.Body:
Fixes #3590

## Proposed changes
- As a fix, I reused the logic from the "ListBox", which uses ItemArray to work with items. ItemArray work with the objects instead of the strings. This avoids the problem when working with items with the same name. 
- Added ItemArray to ComboBoxItemAccessibleObjectCollection
- Updated logic for getting of ComboBoxItemAccessibleObject

After:
![Issue-3590](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/98120776-724a7080-1ebf-11eb-9975-fdac2f49f154.gif)
